alert.note: Alert for Hooker (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 5:12PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cherry, northeastern Grant and northwestern Hooker Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 412 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 19 miles north of Ashby, or 38 miles southeast of Gordon, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Whitman Road crossing the North Branch of the Middle Loup River, Sevenmile Hill, Intersection of Highway 61 and Survey Valley Road, Dipping Vat Meadow and Hire. This includes Highway 61 between mile markers 170 and 185. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
